required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Navigated OCT Imaging With the P200TxE
clinical_study.official_title: Navigated Peripheral OCT Imaging With the P200TxE

brief_summary.textblock: The P200TxE will be used to obtain peripheral OCT (optical coherence tomography) images.

primary_outcome.measure: Qualitative Assessment of OCT Clinical Utility
primary_outcome.description: Clinical utility of the OCT scans will be assessed from the clinician questionnaire using a four point scale.

primary_outcome.measure: Qualitative Assessment of OCT Scan Quality
primary_outcome.description: Image quality of the OCT scans will be assessed from the clinician questionnaire using a four point scale.

secondary_outcome.description: Analysis of safety will be assessed through adverse events reported by the site and documented on each subject's case report form.

intervention.description: The P200TxE Ophthalmoscope provides widefield Scanning Laser Ophthalmoscope (SLO) fundus imaging and Optical Coherence Tomography (OCT) imaging in one device.
